articles.author: Francesco Canepa, Balazs Koranyi
articles.description: The European Central Bank is set to decide on Thursday whether to raise its key interest rate to a record peak in what should be its final step in the fight against inflation, or take a break as the economy deteriorates.
articles.title: ECB considers lifting rates to record high even as economy slows

articles.author: Jorge Garcia
articles.description: Yolanda Cendejas was let go from her job as a studio janitor on May 5, days after Hollywood writers went on strike, leaving the Los Angeles resident without income and the health insurance she needs to cover treatment for her diabetes.
articles.title: Hollywood's janitors swept out of jobs by dual strikes

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. automakers and union negotiators offered little hope a deal would be reached on Thursday to avoid a midnight walkoff that would be the United Auto Workers' first-ever simultaneous strike against the Detroit Three carmakers.
articles.title: Detroit Three strike deadline nears as sides remain far apart

articles.author: Marine Strauss, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Belgium said on Thursday it would review the potential health risks linked to Apple's iPhone 12, becoming the latest European country to react after France ordered a halt to sales citing breaches of radiation exposure limits.
articles.title: Belgium reviews Apple's iPhone 12 after France halts sales over radiation

articles.author: Echo Wang, Anirban Sen
articles.description: SoftBank Group (9984.T) CEO Masayoshi Son was in San Francisco on Wednesday when he joined a call with his bankers in New York to make a final decision about his company's most valuable asset: chip designer Arm Holdings (ARM.O).
articles.title: How SoftBank played it safe in pricing Arm's IPO

articles.author: Xinghui Kok, A. Ananthalakshmi
articles.description: As cash-strapped developer Country Garden battles to stave off default, its sprawling $100 billion development in Malaysia has come under scrutiny from creditors even as the Southeast Asian nation dangles financial incentives to lure investments.
articles.title: 'Seeing is believing': Country Garden's Malaysia project in spotlight

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: French supermarket chain Carrefour (CARR.PA) has slapped price warnings on products from Lindt chocolates to Lipton Ice Tea to pressure top consumer goods suppliers Nestle, PepsiCo and Unilever to reduce inflation ahead of much-anticipated contract talks.
articles.title: Carrefour sticks price warnings on food to shame suppliers

articles.author: Norihiko Shirouzu
articles.description: Tesla (TSLA.O) has combined a series of innovations to make a technological breakthrough that could transform the way it makes electric vehicles and help Elon Musk achieve his aim of halving production costs, five people familiar with the move said.
articles.title: Gigacasting 2.0: Tesla reinvents carmaking with quiet breakthrough

articles.author: Rupam Jain
articles.description: Experts have fanned out in India's southern state of Kerala to collect samples of fluid from bats and fruit trees in a region where the deadly Nipah virus has killed two people and three more have tested positive.
articles.title: India's Nipah virus trackers gather samples from bats, fruit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The first phase of the Ram Temple in India's northern town of Ayodhya will be completed in December and will open to devotees in January, an official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Indian temple built on site of razed mosque to open in January
